trans-unit.source: Represents a fault that can have an associated HTTP status code.

When using a WCF REST endpoint (<xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior>) the HTTP status code on the response is set accordingly.
However, WebFaultException can be used with non-REST endpoints and behaves like a regular <xref:System.ServiceModel.FaultException>.
When using a WCF REST endpoint, the response format of the serialized fault is determined in the same way as a non-fault response.
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] WCF REST formatting, see [WCF Web HTTP Formatting](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebFaultException"></xref> class with the specified <xref:System.Net.HttpStatusCode>.
The HTTP status code to return to the caller.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebFaultException"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> and <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext>.
An implementation of the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable.GetObjectData*> method that is called when an object is serialized to a stream.
The serialization information to which the object data is added when serialized.
The destination for the serialized object.
Gets the <xref:System.Net.HttpStatusCode> associated with the fault.
The HTTP status code associated with the fault.
